Detailed educational program for the second year of the Paris-Saclay CPES

Description of the challenges of the second year, etc.

Distribution of courses in L2

Course details for second year of CPES Paris-Saclay

Core fundamentals block
L2 27 ECTS
Mathematics 2
Lycée International de Palaiseau Paris-Saclay 14 ECTS
Year : Bachelor 2 Period : Throughout the year Title : Mathematics 2 Duration : 30 weeks Course hours : 7 hours per week, 210 hours per year Institution : Lycée International de Palaiseau Paris-Saclay Teaching method : Lectures + Tutorials Credits : 14 ECTS
Course description

This second-year course deepens algebra (vector spaces, matrices, symmetric groups), analysis (integration, sequences and series, differential equations) and probabilities.

The objective is to consolidate and extend first-year knowledge with emphasis on rigor, modeling and solving complex problems.

Computer Science 2
Lycée International de Palaiseau Paris-Saclay 7 ECTS
Year : Bachelor 2 Period : Throughout the year Title : Computer Science 2 Duration : 30 weeks Course hours : 4 hours per week, 120 hours per year Institution : Lycée International de Palaiseau Paris-Saclay Teaching method : Lectures + Tutorials Credits : 7 ECTS
Course description

The second-year computer science program focuses on Python, with a deepening of programming methods, including recursion, induction and sequential and hierarchical data structures.

Students also study advanced algorithmics (exhaustive exploration, graphs, problem decomposition), formal logic and resource management such as memory and files.

Mathematics - Markov Chains
ENS Paris-Saclay 3 ECTS
Year : Bachelor 2 Period : First semester Title : Mathematics - Markov Chains Duration : 12 weeks Course hours : 4 hours per week, 48 hours per year Institution : ENS Paris-Saclay Teaching method : Lectures + Tutorials Credits : 3 ECTS
Course description

The course covers the formal definition, construction of a Markov chain, fundamental properties such as Markovianity, absorbing states, and communication classes.

It also includes key theorems such as the ergodic theorem, convergence to a stationary distribution, and absorption times. This course prepares for in-depth analysis of chains and their various applications in probabilities, statistics and more generally in data science.

Language Interpretation Principles
Paris-Saclay University 3 ECTS
Year : Bachelor 2 Period : Second semester Title : Language Interpretation Principles Duration : 12 weeks Course hours : 3.5 hours per week, 42 hours per year Institution : Paris-Saclay University Teaching method : Lectures + Tutorials Credits : 3 ECTS
Course description

This course is an introduction to language interpretation principles.

Different phases of language interpretation: lexical, syntactic, semantic analysis and execution

Regular expressions, finite automata

Algebraic grammars, word recognition by CYK algorithm, LL top-down parsing

Abstract syntax trees

Simple semantic rules for scope, typing and evaluation

Applied and specialization domains block
L2 24 ECTS
Health Track
Lycée International de Palaiseau Paris-Saclay 6 ECTS
Elective Year : Bachelor 2 Period : Throughout the year Title : Health Track Duration : 30 weeks Course hours : 3 hours per week, 90 hours per year Institution : Lycée International de Palaiseau Paris-Saclay Teaching method : Lectures Credits : 6 ECTS
Course description

This course, based on the second-year program of BCPST preparatory classes, deepens human biology, physiology and health, also integrating genomics, development and cellular communication.

It develops understanding of major physiological processes (immunity, reproduction, nervous system, hormonal regulation), the impact of environmental factors and addresses evolution and phylogeny.

Practical work and document studies aim to reinforce analysis of major body functions related to health.

Society Track
Lycée International de Palaiseau Paris-Saclay 6 ECTS
Elective Year : Bachelor 2 Period : Throughout the year Title : Society Track Duration : 30 weeks Course hours : 3 hours per week, 90 hours per year Institution : Lycée International de Palaiseau Paris-Saclay Teaching method : Lectures Credits : 6 ECTS
Course description

Theme 1: Socialization

  • History and main theoretical approaches to socialization. Study of fundamental concepts and exploration of the diversity of agents, forms and socialization processes through concrete applications of theory.

Theme 2: Deviance

  • Examination of theoretical foundations of deviance analysis, with particular emphasis on interactionist sociology. Study of the medical world through the lens of deviance theories: patient journeys, hospital organization and history of psychiatry.

Theme 3: Social stratification

  • Analysis of the structure and evolution of contemporary society, based on an update of recent work and literature on social stratification.

Theme 4: Social relations and inequalities

  • Study of social relations and dynamics of domination in social space, antagonistic forces structuring conflicts, as well as associated issues and perspectives. Analysis of inequalities and poverty, including their spatial dimension (access to housing, trajectories, appropriation of physical space) and their health implications.

Theme 5: Introduction to political sociology

  • Introduction to the sociology of social movements
Economics, social policies and health
Lycée International de Palaiseau Paris-Saclay 4 ECTS
Year : Bachelor 2 Period : Throughout the year Title : Economics, social policies and health Duration : 30 weeks Course hours : 2 hours per week, 60 hours per year Institution : Lycée International de Palaiseau Paris-Saclay Teaching method : Lectures Credits : 4 ECTS
Course description

Theme 1: Business, governance and organizations

  • Chapter 1: The company: evolution since the early 19th century
  • Chapter 2: Corporate governance and transformation of financial structures

Theme 2: Economic policies

  • Chapter 3: Keynesian policy modeling (IS/LM and AS/AD)
  • Chapter 4: Debate on the role and necessity of public intervention
Statistics 2
ENS Paris-Saclay 3 ECTS
Year : Bachelor 2 Period : Second semester Title : Statistics 2 Duration : 12 weeks Course hours : 4 hours per week, 48 hours per year Institution : ENS Paris-Saclay Teaching method : Lectures + Tutorials Credits : 3 ECTS
Course description

The objective of this course is to deepen statistical inference methods, including point and interval estimation, hypothesis testing, and analysis of variance (ANOVA). It also covers simple linear models, multivariate statistics, and basic stochastic processes.

This course combines theory and practical applications using statistical software, enabling students to design, analyze and interpret quantitative studies in biology or economics.

Data Science 1
École Polytechnique Polytechnic Institute of Paris 2 ECTS
Year : Bachelor 2 Period : First semester Title : Data Science 1 Duration : 15 weeks Course hours : 2 hours per week, 30 hours per year Institution : Polytechnic Institute of Paris Teaching method : Tutorials Credits : 2 ECTS
Course description

This course deepens fundamental techniques for data processing, analysis and modeling. It introduces advanced statistical methods, basic machine learning algorithms, as well as computer tools for managing and exploiting large datasets.

Emphasis is placed on practical implementation and critical interpretation of results in various contexts.

Data Science 2
École Polytechnique Polytechnic Institute of Paris 2 ECTS
Year : Bachelor 2 Period : Second semester Title : Data Science 2 Duration : 12 weeks Course hours : 2.33 hours per week, 28 hours per year Institution : Polytechnic Institute of Paris Teaching method : Lectures + Tutorials Credits : 2 ECTS
Course description

This course offers an advanced approach to statistical methods, supervised and unsupervised learning techniques, and management of large databases.

It emphasizes rigorous model application, critical evaluation of results, and interpretation of complex data. Students develop strong programming skills and use specialized software to address real-world problems in various fields.

Health-Biology Societal Issues
Paris-Saclay University 2 ECTS
Year : Bachelor 2 Period : First semester Title : Health-Biology Societal Issues Duration : 10 weeks Course hours : 3 hours per week, 30 hours per year Institution : Paris-Saclay University Teaching method : Lectures Credits : 2 ECTS
Course description

The objective of this course is to acquire basic knowledge in biology, enabling students to understand biological issues and the nature of data they will encounter.

Living things: from cell to organism

Unity of the living world: Replication, transcription and translation

Genome and sequencing

Gene expression regulation

Evolution in biology

Metabolism and its regulation

Introduction to R and R-Studio for data analysis
Paris-Saclay University 2 ECTS
Year : Bachelor 2 Period : Second semester Title : Introduction to R and R-Studio for data analysis Duration : 12 weeks Course hours : 2 hours per week, 24 hours per year Institution : Paris-Saclay University Teaching method : Lectures Credits : 2 ECTS
Course description

This introduction to R and R-Studio course offers a first initiation to the R language and its working environment. Students learn to manipulate datasets, perform basic statistical analyses and produce clear, reproducible visualizations.

The course uses biology-related datasets.

HEC Electives
HEC Paris 1 ECTS
Year : Bachelor 2 Period : First semester Title : HEC Electives Duration : 6 weeks Course hours : 3 hours per week, 18 hours per year Institution : HEC Paris Teaching method : Lectures Credits : 1 ECTS
Course description

Students must choose one course from:

  • Politics, crises, communication
  • Convictions, data and emotions: how to build a sustainable business
  • Social issues and social policies
  • Labor law
  • Energy transition challenges
  • The pharmaceutical industry: its health issues, risks and opportunities
Data Modeling for social science and business
HEC Paris 1 ECTS
Year : Bachelor 2 Period : Second semester Title : Data Modeling for social science and business Duration : 6 weeks Course hours : 3 hours per week, 18 hours per year Institution : HEC Paris Teaching method : Lectures Credits : 1 ECTS
Course description

This course offers a practical introduction to data modeling applied to social sciences and management, centered on advanced use of Excel.

Students learn to organize, analyze and effectively represent data, while learning the logic of formulas (HLOOKUP, VLOOKUP, SUMIF, SUMIFS) and pivot tables.

Startup and sustainability
HEC Paris 1 ECTS
Year : Bachelor 2 Period : Second semester Title : Startup and sustainability Duration : 6 weeks Course hours : 3 hours per week, 18 hours per year Institution : HEC Paris Teaching method : Lectures Credits : 1 ECTS
Course description

This course explores the links between entrepreneurship and sustainable development, analyzing how startups integrate social and environmental issues into their business models.

Transversal block
L2 9 ECTS
English
Lycée International de Palaiseau Paris-Saclay 4 ECTS
Year : Bachelor 2 Period : Throughout the year Title : English Duration : 30 weeks Course hours : 2 hours per week, 60 hours per year Institution : Lycée International de Palaiseau Paris-Saclay Teaching method : Lectures Credits : 4 ECTS
Course description

This course follows an action-oriented approach across 5 skills (oral and written comprehension, written expression, continuous oral expression and interaction) with work on vowel sound pronunciation.

Interaction is through written and/or audiovisual documents centered on environmental and sustainable development issues and a communication scenario within a year-long project. Intercultural communication may be addressed within the project.

Community Project
Lycée International de Palaiseau Paris-Saclay 2 ECTS
Year : Bachelor 2 Period : Throughout the year Title : Community Project Duration : 20 weeks Course hours : 1 hours per week, 20 hours per year Institution : Lycée International de Palaiseau Paris-Saclay Teaching method : - Credits : 2 ECTS
Course description

The Community Project aims - over the first two years of training - to introduce students to managing projects with social, civic or associative dimensions. Through implementing concrete and sustainable actions for a community, students develop practical skills in project management, teamwork and communication.

HEC Entrepreneur Methods
HEC Paris 1 ECTS
Year : Bachelor 2 Period : Throughout the year Title : HEC Entrepreneur Methods Duration : 3 weeks Course hours : 6 hours per week, 18 hours per year Institution : HEC Paris Teaching method : Lectures Credits : 1 ECTS
Course description

This course introduces students to the main methods and tools used by entrepreneurs.

Students learn to transform an idea into a viable project, structure a business model and pilot the development of an innovative startup in a competitive environment.

Culture / Sports / Second Language (LV2)
Université Paris-Saclay 1 ECTS
Year : Bachelor 2 Period : First semester Title : Culture / Sports / Second Language (LV2) Duration : 12 weeks Course hours : 2 hours per week, 24 hours per year Institution : Université Paris-Saclay Teaching method : Lectures and/or Tutorials Credits : 1 ECTS
Course description

Physical, Sports and Artistic Activities of the student's choice or language teaching.

SPOC Ecological Transition
Université Paris-Saclay 1 ECTS
Year : Bachelor 2 Period : First semester Title : SPOC Ecological Transition Duration : 12 weeks Course hours : 1 hours per week, 12 hours per year Institution : Université Paris-Saclay Teaching method : Small Private Online Course (SPOC) Credits : 1 ECTS
Course description

The main objective of this SPOC is to understand the mechanisms and consequences related to global warming and biodiversity erosion and their relationships with our lifestyles and consumption.

More generally, it aims to provide a transversal vision for understanding global changes, particularly in relation to the UN Sustainable Development Goals and the concept of planetary limits.
